intro: Argomuellera longistipula, commonly known as the long-stipule argomuellera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with long, slender stipules, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories.
